meanings.definition: a period of keeping awake during the time usually spent asleep, especially to keep watch or pray
meanings.sent1: During the vigil, the guard stayed awake to watch for any danger.
meanings.sent2: She lit a candle during the vigil to pray for peace.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept a vigil by the mouse hole, hoping for a midnight snack.
meanings.sent4: The stars kept a silent vigil over the sleeping town.
meanings.sent5: The vigil under the moonlight felt peaceful and serene.

meanings.definition: a watch kept during normal sleeping hours
meanings.sent1: The security guard's vigil at night ensured the building's safety.
meanings.sent2: The baby monitor allowed the parents to keep a vigil while their child slept.
meanings.sent3: The vigilant dog barked at every sound, keeping the household awake.
meanings.sent4: The vigil of the night shift workers kept the factory running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The vigilance of the night watchman prevented any intruders from entering.

meanings.definition: a period of staying awake to keep watch or to pray
meanings.sent1: The sailors kept a vigil on deck to watch for approaching storms.
meanings.sent2: The monks held a vigil in the chapel, praying for guidance.
meanings.sent3: The vigilant owl hooted softly, keeping an eye on the forest.
meanings.sent4: The vigil of the night sky revealed a shooting star streaking across.
meanings.sent5: The vigil before the battle filled the soldiers with determination.
